column3: @10xcryptodev \nDid you see #16808 that addressed the same issue?\nThat pull created some amount of controversy. So other devs' conceptual opinions are needed :)
@hebasto yes, i saw that and followed @laanwj suggestions\n\nAgreed, it's good to see other opinions

Concept NACK - as mentioned in #16808, an `upstream` fix for this would seem more suitable to me, rather than hard coding a fix into this project. 

However I would defer to someone else who has a better understanding of `Qt` and the overall project than myself.

`ku_IQ` seems to work correctly for me. Meaning the only missing languages were `la`, `pam` and `szl` when running with `Qt vers

meh on specifically handling languages due to an upstream issue.\nI guess if we are going to do this, at least a TODO/reminder when to remove this code (after which QT version – if possible) would be nice.

~0. Agree that this is similar to #16808, and ideally not the kind of thing that we'd have to patch/handle ourselves. In any case, given that this is GUI-only, I'm going to suggest re-opening it in the gui repo: https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui.
Instead of commenting the code you could use `QT_VERSION` macro like here:\n\nhttps://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/dc5333d31f280e09bb1e8cdacfbe842f4ab9e69b/src/qt/guiutil.cpp#L885-L892
There needs to be an else() clause here, displaying a fallback for languages for which the name cannot be found so that they don't entirely disappear from the list.
@jonasschnelli @hebasto about the TODO we have this review. TODO or not TODO :)\nUse `QT_VERSION_CHECK` and the comment seems good?
